alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 6:27PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Custer County through 700 PM MDT... At 625 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles east of Miles City. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Custer County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Motorists on US-12 should prepare for rapidly changing conditions. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
